fields.physical_description:
Banner, woven silk and metal thread.
Triangular.  The warp of the main piece runs along the lower edge of the triangle.  The blue border has been stitched to the red centre.
Displayed behind glass.
The central triangular panel has a red ground with a gold lion outlined with red in the centre; the lion's mouth is open and the tongue extended.  The upper half of the sun is behind the lion's back.  It is silver with gold pointed rays, all outlined with red and each point is separated by a fine red line.  Two red locks of hair fall from a point above the forehead of the sun; they fall over the lion's back and curl outwards.  Between the eyes, the nose is formed by the same red line as the eyebrows. There is a gold and red disc in the middle of the brow. The pattern ground is rather clumsily interrupted by the lion and sun and the edges are abrupt although the designer/weaver did manage to get some floral stems around the lion's feet. The ground appears to be silver divided into a lattice.  The bands of the lattice are decorated with a fine red stem, leaves and flowers.  The lattice forms slightly lobed hexagons with a red ground and an inscription in silver.  The inscriptions are in bands and there are 4 different bands.
The broad border is mitred at the corners; it is very wrinkled along the upper edge - WHY?
There are three bands:
[1] silver ground with a fine blue meander linking a diagonal leaf and a 4-petalled flower either side of a wider silver band with a flowing inscription.
[2] wide band, silver ground with lobed blue cartouches with 3 different inscriptions alternating with a 4-lobed compartment with 3 different inscriptions.  There is a partial rosette in blue between these compartments.
[3] as [1].
fields.dimensions: Length: 263 cm maximum, Width: 203 cm maximum
fields.materials_techniques: silk thread, metal thread, weaving, sewing
fields.marks:
Nasr min Allah wa fath qarib (Qur'an 61:13)  Help from God and speedy victory
 Inna fatahna laka fathan mubinan (Qur'an 48:01)  Verily, we have granted you a signal victory
 Huwa Allah ta'ala subhanahu  He is God Most High, may He be praised!
 Huwa'l-a'la al-wali  He is the Most High, the Friend
 Huwa'l-fattah al-`alim  He is the Opener [of gates/sustenance], the All-Knowing
 Qur'an 68:51-52  And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!" But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.
 Ya qahir al-`aduw
Ya vali al-vali
Ya mazhar al-`aja'ib
Ya murtaza Ali  O conqueror of enemies!
O prince of saints!
O manifesting-place of miracles!
O Ali the Chosen!
